q: Why is flood protection important in Sarasota?
a: Sarasota's coastal elevation averages only 9 ft NGVD. Heavy rainfall and storm surge from Big Pass regularly cause back-flow flooding. Installing barriers on ground-level doors prevents loss during Gulf events. See Sarasota Home Flood Barriers.

q: Are permits required for residential flood barriers in Sarasota County?
a: Yes—anchored systems require a minor dry-floodproofing permit filed with Building Dept Sec 108.6. Removable panels are exempt but must meet FEMA TB-3 guidelines.

q: Which flood barrier materials perform best in Sarasota's salt air?
a: Marine-grade aluminum 6063-T5 with 316 stainless hardware provides 20-year corrosion protection. Add clear anodizing for homes within ½ mile of shoreline.

q: Can flood panels be color-matched to neighborhood HOAs?
a: Yes — powder-coat finishes approved by most Sarasota HOAs. See powder-coating options.

q: Do you offer installation for condominiums?
a: Yes, multi-unit projects follow shared engineering drawings and fire-egress reviews. Modular Flood Barrier systems meet code for shared access.
